definitions.definition: In the International System of Units , the base unit of mass ; conceived of as the mass of one litre of water, but now defined by taking the fixed numerical value of the Planck constant h to be 6.626 070 15 × 10 when expressed in units of kg⋅m ⋅s . Symbol: kg
The unit of weight such that a one-kilogram mass is also a one-kilogram weight.

main_definition: In the International System of Units , the base unit of mass ; conceived of as the mass of one litre of water, but now defined by taking the fixed numerical value of the Planck constant h to be 6.626 070 15 × 10 when expressed in units of kg⋅m ⋅s . Symbol: kg
secondary_definitions: ( proscribed ) The unit of weight such that a one-kilogram mass is also a one-kilogram weight.
